image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Washington; born in Tacoma, Pierce County, Wash., September 12, 1935; attended the Pierce County public schools; graduated from Lincoln High School, Tacoma, 1953; attended Whitman College, Walla Walla, 1953-1955; B.A., Central Washington University, Ellensburg, Wash., 1957; broadcaster; public affairs director, KVOS-TV; administrative assistant to United States Representative Lloyd Meeds, 1965-1969; member, Bellingham City Charter Revision; chairman and member, Bellingham Citizens' Advisory Committee on Schools; member, Bellingham Housing Authority; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 1995); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourth Congress; died on April 20, 2018, in Alexandria, Va.

researchRecord.name: 1978-1994, 302 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection documents Allan Swift's operations in both Washington D.C. and in his district offices in Everett and Bellingham. The papers include correspondence, press files, committee files, photographs, speeches, awards, campaign files, and project files. The records document important issues of the late 1970s through the mid-1990s including environmental issues such as clean air, nuclear waste, the spotted owl, and hydroelectric power; telecommunication and broadcasting issues; as well as campaign finance reform and uniform poll closing. There are also some papers from Allan Swift's pre-congressional career, with Bellingham City. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
